column4: are there any grub ninjas kicking around for a quick question?
excellent. well. I finally managed to get ubuntu to boot off of SATA drives (pain in the...) - but the only thing that I've been able to do to get it to boot is remove the "root" line from menu.lst
anyone have any idea if removing the "root" (eg: root(hd2,0) ) line from menu.lst is "A Bad Thing"
are you sure your device.map is correct?
the root entry specified (hd2,0) - which is mapped to the correct device / partition
but grub gives me a "Device not found" on the rood(hd2,0) entry.
the map seems ok (not that i know what your devices physically are), but try running grub-install --recheck
the devices are correct. sda and sdb are 2x160GB SATA, sdc is 120GB SATA (where I am installed)
if i do: "sudo grub-install --recheck hd2" - it gives me no errors, and says all is good
if you're still listening to any of this, I think that hdc is actually my cdrom... can I change the device.map to something else, and then modify the root entried in the menu.lst?
yes, you can edit the map yourself
it checks what the bios says those devices are and saves that for when you boot (since the loader can only use the bios obviously)
thanks, I am gonna give it a whirl.
